snippet: Daniel A. Nigro, commissioner of the New York Fire Department, vowed to attract more minorities and end an era of lawsuits brought on by a lack of diversity.
abstract: Daniel A Nigro is officially appointed commissioner of the New York City Fire Department, during ceremony at the department's training academy on Randalls Island; Nigro, who will oversee the selection of a chief of diversity and inclusion, vows to attract more minorities and end an era of lawsuits brought on by lack of diversity in the department.
lead_paragraph: Daniel A. Nigro, commissioner of the New York Fire Department, vowed to attract more minorities and end an era of lawsuits brought on by a lack of diversity.

headline.main: City’s New Fire Commissioner Vows a Push for More Minorities in the Department
headline.print_headline: City’s New Fire Commissioner Vows a Push for More Minorities in the Department
